description: €7.2M ($8.5M) Seed round co-led by Canaan Partners and IA Ventures. Swiss startup that provides scalable, on-demand human feedback for AI validation — accelerates training, testing, and model improvement. CEO: "Human feedback has become the limiting factor in AI progress."
$69K Seed funding. Early-stage testing startup — signals continued flow of seed capital into testing/QA space even at pre-product stage.

Series E led by Goldman Sachs at $5.5B valuation. Focuses on AI automation for 'after-code' phase — testing, verification, security, deployment. Claims this takes 70% of engineering time. Also acquired Qwiet AI and merged with Traceable (API security).
unverified_note: Source URL could not be independently verified at time of review. Goldman Sachs involvement and $5.5B valuation claimed.

description: Cursor acquires Graphite for $290M. CEO: 'Code review is taking up a growing share of developer time as writing shrinks.' Strongest market signal that validation is the new bottleneck.
Series A led by Jane Street Capital. Patrick Collison (Stripe) among angels. Runs massively parallel AI-driven simulations to find bugs and edge-case failures in complex software systems.
Series A led by Standard Capital with Dropbox Ventures and Y Combinator. Developers describe user flows in plain English; AI automates testing. Competing with Playwright and Selenium.
unverified_note: Momentic is a real YC company. Series A details (Standard Capital, $15M) unverified.

description: Assurant acquires OptoFidelity's mobile device testing portfolio. Strategic expansion into automated hardware/software testing capabilities for mobile devices. Consolidation in device testing space.
Series B led by DST Global at $1B valuation. Uses AI agents to automate penetration testing — claims 100x faster than human testers with more critical vulnerabilities found.
unverified_note: DST Global lead and $1B valuation unverified. Company blog post URL assumed.

description: Series A led by Redalpine. Deutsche Bank and UBS as customers/investors. AI-generated realistic test data — cut test data discovery time in half for Deutsche Bank.
unverified_note: No primary source found for this round. Synthesized is a real company but funding details unverified.

description: Series B bringing cumulative funding to ~$60M. Pushing toward fully autonomous, AI-driven QA that operates within development sprints.
unverified_note: No primary source found. Series B amount and cumulative funding unverified.

description: Series B for automated end-to-end test coverage as a service.
unverified_note: No primary source found for Series B. Company offers QA-as-a-service.

description: Series C led by Thrive Capital at $9.9B valuation. ARR hit $500M. More AI-generated code = more review/testing demand.
Seed round for Franco-Tunisian startup building autonomous AI-powered QA platform. Mission: make testing an accelerator rather than a bottleneck.
unverified_note: No primary source found. Company and funding round unverified.

description: $300M secondary sale at ~$5.8B valuation. Revenue trajectory: $278M→$344M→$408M ARR (2024→2025→2026E). Developer security platform.
Largest cybersecurity acquisition ever — Google acquires Wiz for $32B. Validates security/governance as massive growth center.
Series A. AI-powered code integrity platform — generates tests, reviews code. Direct evidence of investment in AI-augmented testing.
